name: GJ 436
scenarioDescription:
The GJ 436 Exoplanetary System


Overview

GJ 436 is a star with 0.47 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.46 times its radius. It is located 31.832825599999996 light years away from the solar system.

GJ 436 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the GJ 436 system

GJ 436 b

GJ 436 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory using the Radial Velocity method. The mass of GJ 436 b is 22.1 times the mass of Earth. The radius of GJ 436 b is 4.17 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, GJ 436 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system GJ 436, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by W. M. Keck Observatory.
